questions.question: The function of neurons is to:
The myelination of nerve fibres allows for:
To generate a resting potential, which of the following occurs across the membrane:

choices.answer: Na<sup>+</sup> is pumped in + K<sup>+</sup> is pumped out via active transport
Na<sup>+</sup> is pumped in + K<sup>+</sup> is pumped out by facilitated diffusion
Na<sup>+</sup> is pumped out + K<sup>+</sup> is pumped in via active transport
Na<sup>+</sup> is pumped out + K<sup>+</sup> is pumped in by facilitated diffusion

questions.question: An action potential consists of:

choices.answer: Depolarization and repolarization of the neuron

imageMetadata.resources: By OpenStax [CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons CC4.0

questions.resources: By OpenStax [CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons CC4.0

questions.question: During depolarization:

choices.answer: K+ moves into the axon via facilitated diffusion
K+ moves out of the axon via facilitated diffusion
Na+ moves into the axon via facilitated diffusion
Na+ moves out of the axon via facilitated diffusion

imageMetadata.resources: By OpenStax [CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons CC4.0

questions.resources: By OpenStax [CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons CC4.0

questions.question: In contrast, during repolarization:

choices.answer: K+ moves into the axon via facilitated diffusion
K+ moves out of the axon via facilitated diffusion
Na+ moves into the axon via facilitated diffusion
Na+ moves out of the axon via facilitated diffusion

imageMetadata.resources: By OpenStax [CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons CC4.0

questions.resources: By OpenStax [CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons CC4.0

questions.question: Propagation of nerve impulses is the result of local currents causing each part of the neuron:

choices.answer: Between neurons and receptor or effector cells

questions.question: After presynaptic neurons are depolarized they:

choices.answer: Release a neurotransmitter into the synapse
Trigger an action potential within the synapse

questions.question: Acetylcholine (ACh) is broken down in the synapse into:

choices.answer: Choline and acetate by acetyl coenzyme A
Choline and acetyl coenzyme A by acetase
Choline and acetyl coenzyme A by acetylcholinesterase

questions.question: Neonicotinoid pesticides bind to receptors and have which of the following effects on insects:

choices.answer: Activate synaptic transmission at cholinergic synapses
Activate synaptic transmission at adrenergic synapses
Block synaptic transmission at cholinergic synapses
Block synaptic transmission at adrenergic synapses
